channel.title: CyberNetSec - Cyberattack
channel.description: Latest cyberattack threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: PcComponentes Denies Data Breach, Blames Credential Stuffing for Account Takeovers
item.description:
Spanish electronics retailer PcComponentes has denied claims of a massive data breach affecting 16 million customers, stating its internal systems were not compromised. The announcement came after a threat actor, 'daghetiaw,' attempted to sell a large customer database on a hacking forum. The compan...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: China-Linked APT 'UAT-8837' Targets North American Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
A new report from Cisco Talos has identified a China-nexus Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group, tracked as UAT-8837, actively targeting critical infrastructure organizations in North America since at least 2025. The group gains initial access by exploiting public-facing vulnerabilities, including...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Exposed Security Training Apps Like OWASP Juice Shop Create Backdoors into Corporate Clouds
item.description:
A new report reveals a dangerous trend where intentionally vulnerable security training applications, such as OWASP Juice Shop and DVWA, are being deployed on live, production cloud infrastructure and left exposed to the internet. Threat actors are actively scanning for and exploiting these misconfi...

Severity: High

Categories: Cloud Security, Cyberattack, Vulnerability

item.title: 'Skeleton Key' Attacks Bypass Defenses by Weaponizing Legitimate RMM Tools
item.description:
A sophisticated attack campaign dubbed "Skeleton Key" is bypassing traditional, malware-focused security defenses by weaponizing legitimate remote monitoring and management (RMM) software. A report from KnowBe4 Threat Labs details how attackers first compromise user credentials and then abuse truste...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Security Operations, Cyberattack

item.title: Drones Emerge as Urgent Cyber Threat to Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
A report published on January 21, 2026, by the University of Canberra and Cisco warns of the urgent and escalating cyber threat posed by drones to critical infrastructure. The study highlights that as drone technology becomes more advanced, accessible, and affordable, its potential for use in cyber ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: South Korean Giant Kyowon Group Hit by Ransomware, 9.6 Million Accounts at Risk
item.description:
The South Korean conglomerate Kyowon Group has confirmed it suffered a significant ransomware attack that disrupted operations and resulted in data exfiltration. The attack, detected on January 10, 2026, compromised approximately 600 of the company's 800 servers. South Korean authorities estimate th...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

item.title: Threat Landscape Converges as Attackers Target ICS and AI Systems
item.description:
New research from Cyble highlights a dangerous convergence of threats, as both hacktivists and financially motivated cybercriminals are increasingly targeting Industrial Control Systems (ICS), Operational Technology (OT), and enterprise AI systems. The report, published January 20, 2026, notes that ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack

item.title: ScarCruft APT: North Korean Hackers Evolve Tactics in 'Artemis' Campaign
item.description:
The North Korean advanced persistent threat (APT) group ScarCruft, also known as APT37 or Reaper, has launched a new campaign dubbed 'Artemis'. Active since late 2025, the campaign targets entities likely in South Korea using malicious Hanword Word Processor (HWP) documents. Researchers report that ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Manhunt: Black Basta Ransomware Leader Added to EU's Most Wanted List After Raids
item.description:
An international law enforcement operation has targeted the prolific Black Basta ransomware group, which is linked to over 600 attacks and millions in ransom payments. Police in Ukraine conducted raids against two suspected members of the syndicate. Concurrently, an international arrest warrant and ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

item.title: Public Exploits Released for Critical SQLi and RCE Flaws in Business Software
item.description:
Multiple critical and high-severity vulnerabilities have been disclosed in various business software products, with proof-of-concept (PoC) exploits made public, elevating the risk of immediate attack. A critical SQL injection flaw (CVE-2026-1179) affects Yonyou KSOA 9.0. A critical command injection...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack
